indiancalendar

Class Panchang

  • java.lang.Object
    • indiancalendar.Panchang

  • public class Panchang
extends java.lang.Object
    Panchang class is used for telling the Panchang and month of Indian luni-solar calendar for the Gregorian Date given Panchang includes five parts:
    • Tithi
    • Nakshatra
    • Yog
    • Karana
    • Vaar

    Note: Indian National Calendar follows Purnimanta not Amanta and same is followed here. This class internlly uses other classes for calculations for longitudes of sun and moon for a given point of time. All calculations are made using Date and Calendar APIs that have many parts to improve. These APIs consider the start of time from the Epoch, January 1, 1970 00:00:00.000 GMT (Gregorian). So minimum supported date is January 1, 1970 00:00:00.000 GMT (Gregorian). And if the Java version in less than 1.8 then calculations might have problems. Since 1.8, we have all new improved Date and Time API. All calculations are done for New Delhi, India (location: 28°36'46.2"N 77°13'51.9"E).

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    IndianFestivals, RiseAndSet

      • Panchang

        public Panchang()

      • Panchang

        public Panchang(java.lang.String maas,
                java.lang.String paksha,
                java.lang.String tithi,
                int gregorianYear)
        Initializes a newly created Panchang object so that it represents tithi for given maas, paksha, tithi in the gregorianYear.
        Parameters:
        maas - Name of maas
        paksha - Name of paksha
        tithi - Name of tithi
        gregorianYear - Gregorian year for which Panchang is to be calculated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if Krishna paksha and Purnima tithi or Shukla paksha and Amavasya tithi is passed as argument as supported format is Purnimanta but entered tithi is Amanta.

        public Panchang(java.util.Date date)

      • getGregorianDate

        public static java.util.Date getGregorianDate(Panchang pan)
        Calculates the Gregorian date of a particular tithi.
        Parameters:
        pan - Object of the Panchang representing a tithi whose Gregorian date is to be calculated
        Returns:
        Date of a particular tithi
